         Stuffing herself hadn't been easy, especially as the new girl on the Calgri. Most had never seen an overweight person before. They all stared and murmured to each other about it. The stares and murmurs became rude comments and a talk with the medical officer as Jan's weight had started piling on they didn't understand. She had never felt better. This is who she wanted to be. She wasn't just Janice the thin girly engineer, she was Janice: the womanly shaped engineer, but that was then, this was now.

         The woman started shuffling back to her dorm, the cool air of the ship felt good against her taut skin, her exposed nipples stood up as she finally reach her room, the rush of cold air relaxed her and reminded her she was too big for her jumpsuit, which excited her. She crawled into her bed and slumped onto her back, he belly looming over her. Her hands helped her to sleep by gently rubbing her overstuffed tummy to aid in it's digestion.

"Oh to be fat..." she whispered to herself as she fell into sleep.
1312.title: Midnight Binge and Untold Knowledge

choices: She tells them about her ambitions
She says nothing
Other people enter, ending the private conversation
The Doctor is already aware the FDS is giving out extra calories
13121.content:
Janice awoke like she had for the past couple of months, with an alarm and notification of what was for breakfast today. She quickly showered and got dressed, relishing in how her hips were quite snug in her jumpsuit. She entered the Mess Hall early with Todd and Sam, as usual, the three sharing hugs.

"You're looking good today." Todd remarked, his hand dragging along her waist as their hug ended.

"Thank you." Jan replied with a smirk. Sam simply looked at her for a moment, trying to see what was different. Jan quickly went over and swiped her card, excited to be eating again. The FDS did something that Todd and Sam had never seen before. It stuttered and processed, a slight ticking sound rattling out as it calculated Jan's calorie ration. The two stared in confusion and Jan in excitement as it printed out and rather large meal, one that will certainly keep her enlarged stomach full for several hours. The other two go on to get their own rations, Sam's being larger than Todd's.

"Jan, doncha think that's ah big plate uh food?" Sam asked as they all sat down together.

"It is, uh, kinda big..." Todd said, noticing the slightly larger bulge of Jan's stomach.

"Seems normal to me." Jan replied, popping a bit of food into her waiting mouth. "Besides, the FDS doesn't make mistakes." she tugged on her jumpsuit's zipper, trying to make it more comfortable.

"Yea, but, seriously, that's a lot of food." Todd said, watching her eat. Jan kept eating, but her mind raced. Would her friends judge her for eating so much? She didn't dare have a repeat of the Calgri.

"Maybe you just have less food?" Jan's pace picked up slightly.

"We have normal rations." Sam said, the irony lost on her.

"Well, what would I do? Just not eat it? It dings the doctor if I don't and that's something I don't want to deal with." Jan shoved a particularly large bite into her mouth, she struggled slightly chew it.

"Choking on your Food isn't going to help." Sam injected. Jan made eye contact with her and then looked back at her food. She pursed her lips and looked at Todd.
13121.title: Feedback Loop of Calories

choices: Jan ignores her duties and starts to binge daily
Sam and Todd attempt another intervention for Janice
Janice starts getting the crew to feed her
131213.content:
Jan pursed her lips again and sighed, "It all started-" her voice died off quickly as other people entered the mess hall. Jan's face turned red as she looked down at her plate, and resumed eating quietly, as did the others.

* * *

"What do you think she was going to say?" Sam pondered, wrapped in Todd's arms in the engineering.

"No telling, something from her childhood? She went to her room and hasn't left." Todd replied.

"I don't know..." she replied, hugging him tightly.

* * *

Jan sat in her room binge eating, for the first time in years. She had gone to her room and cried it out, then waited for everyone to go to their stations. When the coast was clear, she left her room and started ordering food, piles of food, as much as it would let her at one time. She carried it back to her dorm and started feasting. She repeated this throughout the day, avoiding contact with everyone. By the end of the day, she lay comatose, her stomach red and taught as it loomed over her, her body working into overdrive to digest it all. She remained asleep through the next day. When she woke up the next day, her stomach ached, but that seemed to be the only side-effect, aside from a tightness covering her legs. She got up and looked down at herself, then her full-length mirror. Her jumpsuit was open on the front, exposing her chest and belly. She seemed softer, but she wasn't sure. Her eyes move further down to her hips and legs. she reached a hand down and rubbed them, her suit felt so incredibly tight, but soft underneath. She peeled it off, her thighs bulging out as she did.

"Oh yes..."
131213.title: Too Embarrassed to Confess

choices: Tel'cantir
Kellitac
Alaamtila
133.content:
It was a month into the journey. The ship was in the midst of deep space. There was literally nothing for light-years in all directions. Nothing of any note had happened since they left the galaxy.

Which is why it was so concerning when something appeared on the scanners.

It wasn't even the long range scanners. Captain James had accidentally pressed the scanner button and it returned with a scan of an object twice the size of their ship - and on an intercept trajectory.

"James, there's nothing we can do at this time. This freighter has no defensive capabilities."

"C'mon Jax. There's got to be something we can do." James said pacing his private cabin. The scan of the object was projected into the middle of the room where him and the security officer had been studying it. "I'll try another scan."

"That may well alert them of our position. Maybe it could be a ship, maybe it could be an asteroid of some kind. Just change our trajectory a little and we'll miss it by a lightyear." Jax said. leaning back in the captain's desk chair. James was visibly shaken at the thought of it being a ship.

"If it's a ship on a insect course, it already knows we're here." James reasoned, exiting his cabin and heading towards the bridge.

"As long you change our trajectory, I've no qualms." Jax said, a few paces behind him. When he entered the bridge, James was seated at the console. The two pensively watched the scanner as the wave emanated from their ship. The image returned, more detailed than before. The scan read back agonizingly slow for them. Line after line of pixels built the image in a one-sided 3D image of the object. Except it wasn't an object.

It was a ship.

James sat with his hands over his mouth and nose. Jax stared in fear at it. It was alien in design. They hadn't seen anything like it before, not even from xenoarchaeologist finds.

"What do we do?" Jax asked

"There's nothing we can do." James responded. "They'll upon us in a few days." a light appeared on the console. They being scanned, heavily. The two officers watched as the light flickered for a few hours. Then, a message appeared in the console. Jax opened it for the captain.

"SURRENDER AND LIVE"

"What do you think, sir?" Jax asked. There was no response as the captain stared at the message. "Sir?"

"...Sir?"

"We have to surrender." James said into his hands

"But we don't know if we can trust them." Jax responded harshly.

"We don't have a choice. They know we're here, their ship is bigger and probably armed enough to destroy us in an instant. Our only hope is to surrender." James said as he pulled up an interface to make an announcement to the entire crew. He made the announcement to which some of the crew voiced concerns, but reached consensus that surrender was their best option. After several days, the aliens arrived and boarded their ship. What species was it?

Tel'cantir: These humanoids will use the crew as energy batteries, meaning they will store massive amounts of energy in them, as fat.

Kellitac: This squid-like race will probably fatten the crew up for 'research' purposes. As well as trying to make them do things under observation for 'research'

Alaamtila: This beyond-ancient race of machines have a strange fascination with fat humans, similar to ancient humans. Perhaps they're looking for a certain shape or weight?
133.title: The Deep Dark, Darker, Yet Darker of Space.

choices: Follow Meredith
Follow Janice
Follow Sam
1331.content:
The alien ship loomed over the Rimor, the largest object for light years. A smaller ships, roughly half the size of the Rimor approached and docked. The bridge lit up as scans bombarded every system. The crew had assembled in the mess hall and said their goodbyes, not knowing what would become of them. Appearing on the ship were the humanoid beings. They quickly made their way to the mess hall, the first strode in, near seven feet tall. Six eyes greeted the crew behind it's helmet's visor and two arms held a staff and a small orb. Following it were two smaller ones, both about six foot in height. They too had six eyes and four arms, but held only shackles. They quickly shackled the crew and drug them to their vessel. The vessel departed and flew back to it's mothership, the Rimor staying stationary in the vast emptiness of deep space, never to be seen again.

"What do you think they'll do tah us?" Sam whispered to Janice.

"I don't know." she whispered back, terror in her voice.

"Chul-chul tulut xu ban tat!" one of the aliens responded,it's voice fluctuating in pitch as it spoke. It's mandibles flexed in an unsettling manner upon finishing.

"They wouldn't take us alive just to kill us." Dr Meredith assured herself, hands quivering in her shackles. They quickly reached the large ship and docked, the crew was pulled through and into the ship. The interior of the ship was a strange mix of organic and non-organic materials. Most moving parts were organic, like the internal doors and panels, while some walls were made of strange metals. Each one was brought in front of a scanner and scanned, making each shake as their entire body was stimulated. Women were sent to the right, and men to the left. This not a silent separation, but they knew they had no fighting chance. The women were, again, scanned. This time it was much more intense, every fiber of their being. The three of them were lined up and another alien came up, holding what appeared to be clipboards.

It pointed to Meredith, "Cuth" and she was taken away towards the life support.

It pointed to Janice, "Gelux" and she was carried to the engineering core.

It pointed to Sam, "Chaxaxl" and she was drug to the armory.
1331.title: The Tel'cantir of Deep Space

choices: Lethargic Water
High Calorie Fruits & Veggies
Milky Livestock

Captain James pressed the call button on his console to try and reach engineering but was met with a shower of sparks and the console going dark.
"Jax! Get Janice up here now!" he barked at his security officer. Jax was already out the door headed to engineering.

However, the situation in engineering was a bit worse.
"What do you mean the AI stopped working?" Todd shouted as he put a fire out.
"It just stopped, the whole system's crashed!" Janice said standing from her smoking console.
"The engine's gone into over drive, the ship's practically driving herself blind!" Sam yelled also trying to put out a fire.
"Are proximity warnings still operable?" Todd asked trying to check a maintenance panel, but it was too hot to open.
"No, they're not." Jax said entering the room
"Jax?" the three engineers asked
"Yea, bridge is going crazy. Janice can you help?" he asked looking straight at her.
"Things are a bit haywire here!" Janice replied trying to rewire her console.
"We need to get the bridge back up, that's an order." Jax responded
"Alright alright, fine." Janice said setting the console panel down and going with Jax.

Once they reached the bridge again, Janice sat her wide hips in a seat and started working on a console. "Okay, I got the Comm system working again." Immediately several hails hit the bridge at the same time, being in credibly loud. The captain cancelled all of them and put out his own.
"All hands, the ship is critically malfunctioning. Give status reports in designated order." he took his hand off the comm and waited.
"Engineering is on fire and the engines are out of control."
"Medical is compromised, Life Support at full operation."
"Cargo is on fire, but currently undamaged."
"Can you tell why fire suppression isn't working?" James asked Janice
"No telling. A lot of this wiring is fried. Silver wire? Why!?" she replied without looking up. Another screen flicked on and the main display hologram flickered in the middle of the room.
"Aw hell." James and Jax said in almost unison as it showed a crash trajectory with a uncharted planet. James zoomed into the trajectory as the scanners flipped back on and showed it landing almost tangent with a ocean. The prediction was the ship would skip a couple times along the ocean and crash into the shore of a large continent.
"Should we launch escape pods?" Jax asked the Captain.
"Nah, we've got an almost perfect landing vector. This is the best crash landing we could hope for." he reached over for the comm, which sparked when he pressed it. "Crew, we're set to crash land on a unknown planet. We have an almost perfect landing vector. In about one hour we will skid across the planet's ocean and crash into the shore. I ask everyone to continue damage control and to go to emergency stations after."
"Good speech, captain."Jax said.
"Thanks."
"Okay, basic systems are online, but I can't reset the AI from here. Can I go back to engineering?" Janice asked, placing the console back in place as it's lights flickered back on
"Yes ma'am, thank you." James responded as his computer started reading out reports.

Janice jogged back to Engineering, properly winded by the time she got back. Most of the fires were put out, smoke billowed into the air intake to be filtered.
"How's it going" Janice asked breathlessly, resting against a wall.
"Most of the fires are out, but a lot of circuitry is burned out." Todd responded as Sam was working on replacing broken parts.
"How'd it go in tah bridge?" Sam asked.
"Oh, you know, a lot of basic programming stuff. This ship is crappily wired."
"What else is knew?"
"Yea yea" Janice replied as she set about fixing wires.

The crew was successful in minimizing damage from the fires and soon piled into their escape pod bays (which were the emergency stations). Soon after the ship rocked and rattled as loose objects were thrown about as the ship skipped once, twice, and the start gliding across the surface of the ocean. It rapidly slowed before finally beaching itself. The crew stayed in their stations for a bit, regaining their senses. In the bridge, the few working scanners were underway analyzing the atmosphere. It read that it was breathable. A party was sent out and they gathered some water and soil to analyze, which they found that the ocean water was equivalent to fresh water from Earth. The soil also was compatible with Earth crops.

"How is this not on the colony charts?" James asked himself as the crew all departed to the beach. "Engineering, report."
"It's bad, it took all out spare parts to stabilize the reactor. No telling how much work will need to be done to repair her fully." Todd reported.
"Well, with our cargo it shouldn't take too much work huh?" James said with a smile. Just then, there was a loud hiss and the primary engine blew out, sending shrapnel into the ocean behind it. The entire crew had gone prone to avoid anything, and everyone was safe. Todd quickly went to the Engineering deck and found that the whole room had been destroyed almost.
"Captain, even with the advanced machinery, we don't have the materials to rebuild an entire engine and reactor."
"Very well." James said despondently, "Use what power we have to try and print some seeds for food and then put out a distress call. I guess we can use the ship for shelter, and uh... uh, just see how it goes."
"Aye, Captain"

*****

Option 1:
There is something in the water, it only effects people with high estrogen (read females only) that makes them hungrier and slows their metabolism.

Option 2:
The food is just incredibly high calorie on this planet. The men find work or other things to burn it off, but the women? Not so much.

Option 3:
The crew finds essentially livestock that they can harvest, the milk from a few of them causes the women to start bulking up and producing their own milk (big milky boobs, basically)
134.title: A Whole New World

choices: Excitedly shares her findings
Waits to see if anyone even wants to eat native foods
Says nothing, but notes feeling softer the very next day
1342.content:
A few days after crashing, Dr Meredith had finished clearing the medical bay of everything that would spoil or cause problems if left unchecked. Much of the medicine was left and all the bandages, but all her bacteria samples were lost, which meant a few months of work lost, but she still had her notes. She walked along the beach, taking in the air, which didn't have the salt quality she had come to expect from beaches. She had noted that the crew seemed in good spirits despite having the highly ration the available food. She had taken to carrying her notebooks with her, just in case.

"Well, it looks kinda similar," she ran her fingers along some tall grass, it was green but had a sort of chameleon effect on the edges, which pulsed ever so slightly if you took the tie to stop and watch it. "I wonder if anyone else has taken the time to notice this. I doubt it." she mumbled to herself as she sketched some plants, then a small bird she saw pecking the beach sand. It had a long beak, using it for pulling small shellfish from the sand and broke them open with it's claws. A yellow crest adorned it head, red and blue feathers patterned it's wings and torso. "Such beauty." Meredith had always loved nature.

The bird suddenly shot into the air and started flying inland, Meredith in her state of wonder eagerly followed it, the temperate and tropical trees quickly overtook her view of the sky, but the bird was staying low to the ground, a grassy trail leading them deeper into the woods. Multi colored flowers and the chameleon grass framed her path as she followed the bird, which came to perch on a branch, it rested a moment as Meredith caught up, notebook still in hand. "Why you fly so far inland?" she pondered to herself as the bird pruned itself a bit, then hopped over to a hole in the tree, where three smaller versions of the bird stuck their heads out. "Ah! Getting food for your little babies." Meredith chuckled to herself as she quickly sketched the smaller birds, their feathers were a distinct moss green, the same color as the leaves and bark of their home tree. It had been a long time since she had seen real birds, even longer since seeing them in their natural habitat. She finished her sketch as mama bird darted straight into the sky to fly off. "Such strange flight patterns" she thought aloud as she started walking back, taking in the flora much more this time.

"So much ... fruit?" Meredith thought as she picked something that looked like an orange. The branches of the tree were bending under the weight of all the fruit on it. She brought it up to her nose to smell, but stopped herself short. "What am I doing? I need to scan it first." she procured a sampling device from her bag, a gift from when she got her PhD, this would be her first time using it. Using on of the tools on it she took a sample of the fruit and after a few moment of scanning, the result came back that it was safe for human consumption. Meredith smiled as she brought it up to her nose to smell, which caught her off guard because it smelt like an apple. "Alright, looks like an orange, smells like an apple, taste like a..." she took a bite and savored it's strong sweet taste, " ... banana? Well then." she snacked on the fruit, finishing it before taking sketches of the tree. "I've had this sketch book ten years and this is the second time I've used it. So glad I kept it." she thought, picking some more fruit to eat, she found them to not be very filling. If she had looked further at the scan, she would've seen that it contained 100 calories in the 1 gram sample. Meredith grabbed another and started eating her third fist sized fruit.

As she kept walking she also found several types of what we would call peppers, melons, gourds, squash,and a menagerie of other plants, all safe for human consumption. Meredith found all of these to be extremely tasty, and not filling, it took her whole day of exploring and cataloging, filling several pages of her sketchbook with detailed drawings of the plants. Again and again throughout the day, the samples kept coming with very high calorie to weight ratio, most of them containing at least 2000 calories per fruit/vegetable. When Meredith gets back to the ship, she:

14.title: Scenario: The Sorcerer's Feeder

choices: Delphina, the ancient cultist
Hilda, the medieval peasant
Sasha, the modern day bookworm
141.content:
No one knows the true origin of the Tome of Weight. The book itself seems ageless, its cover made out of a soft leather which somehow seems to resist all attempts to damage the book. Within it are many pages, with the words inside always written in a language that its reader can understand. Why such an old and indestructible relic only contains spells to make people fatter is but one of the mysteries about the book.

Since the Tome is ancient, it has had many owners across the millennia in which it has existed. Listed below are but a few of their names:

- Delphina, who lived during the time of Classical Greece. She discovered the Tome not long after being inducted into one of the many Mystery Cults in that era, and viewed the book as nothing less than a divine revelation of the Goddess of Plenty that her cult worshipped. Will Delphina use the book to advance her cult's goals, or only just her own?

- Hilda, a peasant girl who lived in medieval Europe. She found the Tome in an old Roman ruin not far from her family's farm. Having a book of magic would, of course, put her at risk of being tried and executed as a witch by her friends and neighbors. However, is it also the only way for her to escape the dreary serf's life that she'd otherwise be destined to live?

- Sasha Boxer, a senior in a modern day USA high school. Ostracized for her awkwardness and chubbiness, Sasha retreated to the world of books. She bought the Tome from an antique shop, and soon discovered that its powers were real. Will she use the book to try and make friends, get revenge on her tormentors, or indulge in her own hidden fantasies?

Whose story will we follow?
141.title: The Tome of Weight

choices: used a spell on herself
took the book home
more
1412.content:
Life in medieval Europe wasn't easy for peasants. Grueling labor was necessary just to put food on the table. Unlike the wealthy, the peasant class had few privileges and were frequently caught up in crimes. Punishments were harsh, one could only hope for a quick death. Despite their troubles, the people still pressed on in hopes of a better life.

Hilda was a teenage peasant girl living on her family's farm. They were struggling to weather the famine that was wreaking havoc among the countryside. Hilda and her family had grown skinny, not that they were ever healthy, and any amount of calories were appreciated. Hilda often fantasized about being wealthy. She dreamed of eating tons of delicious food all day and lazing around without ever needing to lift a finger. She imagined herself much larger. Much heavier. Hilda fantasized about her frill body being encased in layers of soft blubber. A massive belly that reached to the floor, bulbous buttocks laiden with luxurious cellulite, gelatinous breasts, wide thighs, and sagging arm fat. But that was far from reality. As bad as she wanted, Hilda could never gain any weight, she was just a peasant girl living with her destitute family on a struggling farm.

One day one of the goats got loose. Immensely valuable to the farm, Hilda couldn't let the goat escape. Hilda followed the goat for only a few minutes before stopping in an ancient Roman ruin. Curious, Hilda tied the goat to a post and entered the ruin.

Upon entering, Hilda noticed that the walls were encrypted with carvings of plump women. Walking further down the hall, Hilda observed many statues of women fatter then she's ever seen. It all led to a large book placed on a pedestal. Tempted, Hilda opened the book. Amazingly the book was written in Hilda's language. Hilda began to read from the ancient Tome.

To her surprise the book was all about fat women loaded with spells and incantations for weight gain. Some spells were gradual and modest, others were instant and drastic. There were spells that specified certain body parts. There were spells powerful enough to fatten an entire village.

Hilda than....
1412.title: Hilda, the medieval peasant

choices: tell her family
keep it to herself
14122.content:
Despite being dumbfounded by the magnificent book, Hilda had prior obligations. Closing the book and tucking it away, Hilda grabbed the goat's reigns and returned it back to her modest farm. Securing the goat to its pen, Hilda than went inside for some nourishment. She was so weakened from malnourishment that her little venture left her fatigued.

Entering her home she was greeted by her mother. The rest of Hilda's kin was out laboring the farm. Hilda's mother had grown rather slim during the famine. Never was she a woman of healthy girth but she at least had a little bit of meat on her. Now the matron of the family could only watch as her body withered thinner and thinner. Her already small clothes now hung loose from her scrawny frame. She was so embarrassed about her thin body.

"Mom can I please have something to eat? I had to chase after the goat and that burned too many calories." Hilda pleaded.

Her mother placed a stale slice of bread before her. "Sorry Hilda, but that's all we can spare."

Unappealing bread was still food to Hilda so she eagerly gobbled it up. Hilda sighed out of a yearning for more food. Unable to provide any more sustenance, her mother continued the house work. Allowing herself a brief respite, Hilda sat at the table and pulled out the book. She opened the book to a page depicting what appeared to be a slim woman standing next to a fat woman reading 'Moderate Gain.' Interested Hilda read the passage which contained a sort of incantation. Hilda read it, unintentionally muttering as she read.

"Hilda dear, what are you muttering?" Hilda's mother asked while scrubbing the kettle.

Suddenly Hilda's mom felt a tingly sensation ripple through her body. A warmth flowed inside the mother's body causing it to expand. She could feel her body soften. Her unsightly bones vanished under rapidly forming blubber. Her loose clothes began to hug her growing body. Hilda's mother felt the flesh jiggle on her body. Fat had caked itself on her twig like legs, folds cascaded down her backs, love handles spilled over her sides, flesh sagged from her arms, her cave in gut swelled into a squishy globe, and her flat chest morphed into boobs that poured out of her shirt.
"Oh my!" squealed the jubilant woman.

Hilda looked up from the book at her mother. She noticed an extra 150 pounds resting on her mother's figure. Taking a couple seconds to register the phenomenon before her, Hilda fell to a state of awe. Her mom's fattened body sat at an envious 240 pounds which had thrashed her loose clothes rendering them to mere rags barely covering her plentiful flesh.

"Mom!" Hilda exclaimed jumping from her seat. "What happened to you?"

"I have no idea. I suddenly felt warm and then my body fattened up." explained the gleeful woman.

Hilda immediately fondled her mother's new fat, caressing her many folds.

"You're so soft." Hilda awed.

"I feel amazing." her mother giggled. "It is truly a blessing from God."

"A blessing from Go-" Hilda than realized that her mother's miraculous fattening was caused by her book.

Hilda rushed back to the book, firmly holding it.

"Hilda what have you got there?" asked the blimped up matron.

Hilda than analyzed her situation. Should she tell her mother and family of the book and potentially put herself at risk or should she act prudently and keep the book's powers a secret.
14122.title: The book's first blessing

choices: a fast food place
a donut shop
A bakery
142.content:
Inside of an old antique shop, a woman with a very svelte figure as well as a one piece leotard came in as she rung the bell. As soon as she did, a figure in a cloak approached her. "How may I help you?"

151.content:
All across the nation, screens were lit aglow with the National News Network logo. Televisions, phones and tablets cast a baby blue hue across audiences everywhere as they eagerly awaited what many considered to be the story of a lifetime.

The voice of popular anchorwoman Nikki Rowe was cast over the stylized NNN, which cut away to footage of overweight midwestern citizens. Multiple shots of various people going about their daily lives, their faces obscured for protective purposes. But all of them were very, very fat.

A town with such a high percentage of obesity ratings couldn’t have simply cropped up overnight. These people had lived here for generations, but a simple internet article not long ago had pulled back the curtain on the flyover town of Conrad—a city where more than seventy percent of its population could be classified as morbidly obese. A whopping thirty percent of those were even larger than that.

It was just as simple as that—a simple town, one simple article on the internet, and everything had changed. Suddenly everyone had to know about this mysterious town. What was the reason behind everyone’s high weights? How did they function? What were their cultures and traditions? People were disgusted, revulsed, curious, or interested otherwise in this strange little town. For whatever reason, they couldn’t look away.

“For the Fat, by the Fat—this seems to be the way of life for the people in Conrad.” Rowe’s voice carried over the footage, “My crew and I went deep into the heart of the town that has taken America by storm with its curious outlook towards obesity and body positivity.”


“It’s just how things are done here, I guess.” One local woman, with her swaddling chins and heavy breasts, said in a mild sort of way before chuckling “I mean, ain’t nobody gonna make anyone feel bad about a little extra fluff ‘round here… unless they ain’t got enough of it.”

“My whole family’s always been pretty big.” Said a large man in his forties, his small mustache looking ridiculous on his round face and full lips, “I guess we don’t really stop to think about it.”



“For two months, my crew and I lived in Conrad, hoping to get to the bottom of this strange phenomenon.”

Nikki Rowe had always been a small woman. Petite and pixie-esque. A replacement for the woman who had aged out of the sexy reporter business not long ago. She had been a fan favorite not only due to her habit for hard-hitting exposes and deep-undercover practices, but also for her gorgeous looks and striking features. Among the pretty blonde sex kittens behind the desk and the distinguished, generic men who babbled placidly to their audience, Nikki Rowe stood out. Her absence on the air had been felt, and everyone had been eagerly awaiting her return—what they found upon her return was shocking.

”Who are you to come in and judge us for how we live our lives?” a particularly plump sophomore at the local community college, dressed in dark clothing with bright hair that framed her round face bellowed, “All anyone wants to do is judge me—judge fat people. End the body shaming, wake up America!”


Jumping back to the main reporter’s desk, jaws across the nation dropped as they saw Nikki Rowe for the first time in months. Gone were her slim jaw, her tight waist, and the tight T&A that had secured her the male 18-45 audience. In just two months, everyone’s favorite reporter looked to have put on fifty pounds of pure fat—most of it settling right in her belly.

But Nikki Rowe wasn’t the only one who had gone to Conrad and come back corpulent. People all across the nation, be they hesitant or hopeful that such a fat-topia could exist, had made pilgrimages to the sleepy midwestern city. And most of them, tourist or migrant, had put on at least some weight. Just not quite as quickly as everyone’ favorite reporter had.

“My time in Conrad has… leant me a few extra pounds.” Nikki admitted sheepishly, “I… I’ll admit that it’s all rather tempting. Everyone’s so friendly and warm towards you, even if you’re an outsider like I was. Or my crew.”

“It almost sounds like you miss it.” Kevin Timms, one of the other NNN reporters, said with a laugh as he eyed Nikki’s bloated middle with revulsion and amusement, “Get a little hooked on all that sugar, did ya?”

The other reporters gave him dirty looks.

“We never found the root cause of the town’s fascination with… well, with fat.” The plump reporter said to her colleague, and then to the camera, “But it’s unlike anything you’ve ever experienced before.”

***


That was five years ago.

And since then, Conrad has grown immensely. The attention attracted by the constant news cycle attracted new businesses. Those created new jobs, and in turn, more people began to look at Conrad not as the latest internet fascination, but as a viable place to live and lay their hats.

People came. People grew. Conrad now has the fastest growing population in the country, in more ways than one…

But that's a story for another time.

More importantly... what kind of story are we going to be telling today?
